name: Dream Nexus
window: At the end of your tactical actions:
windowEffect: You may place or move 1 nexus token into the active system. Systems with your nexus tokens are adjacent for your units except when retreating. Nexus tokens cannot be placed in your home system.

name: The Waking
window: At the start of the status phase:
windowEffect: Any player with at least 1 ship in a system containing a nexus token may choose to remove it.

name: Incomprehensible Form
window: When you would lose a ship during combat:
windowEffect: You may instead remove 1 of your nexus tokens from the active system.

name: Refraction
window: After another player produces 1 or more hits against your units during space combat:
windowEffect: You may assign 1 of those hits to 1 of your non-fighter ships in an adjacent system.

name: Fragmentation
window: After one of your non-fighter ships in the active system is destroyed during combat:
windowEffect: You may place 1 fighter from your reinforcements in that system.

name: Phoenix Rising
window: When you roll for your infantry's text ability:
windowEffect: On a result of 9 or 10, you may immediately place that unit back into combat. If you do, you cannot resolve that unit's text ability.

name: Beauty in Destruction
window: After one of your non-fighter, non-faction specific units is destroyed during combat:
windowEffect: You may purge that unit from the game and spend 3 resources to gain its corresponding unit upgrade.

name: Mechanized Military
windowEffect: Take the 2 additional Iron Tide mechs and place them in your reinforcements; You have 6 mechs.

name: Exo-Atmospheric
permanentEffect: Your mechs count as ships and may participate in both ground and space combat.

name: Iron Resilience
permanentEffect: Your ground forces cannot be removed by any game effects outside of combat.

name: Planetary Reconfiguration
windowEffect: You may attach any 1 of your Designs from your reinforcements to that planet if it does not already have one. When you lose control of a planet with a design attached to it, return that card to your reinforcements. Designs do not count as attachments for the purposes of scoring objectives.

name: Efficient Governance
window: During the agenda phase, if an outcome you voted for passes:
windowEffect: Ready up to 2 planets you exhausted to vote.

name: System Breach
window: When one of your neighbours places a structure using the primary or secondary ability of the 'Construction' strategy card:
windowEffect: You may compromise that structure by placing a compromised token underneath it. Then, you may spend 3 resources to compromise an additional structure placed by any other player.

name: Control Network
permanentEffect: Compromised PDS have -1 to rolls against your ships. You may use a compromised space dock you are blockading to produce ships as if it were your own.

name: Ransomware
window: When you resolve your Control Network ability:
windowEffect: Each player who controls 1 or more of the chosen structures may give you 1 trade good per compromised structure they control. For each trade good a player gives you, you cannot choose 1 structure they control for this use of that ability.
